item.title: [Leetcode] UTF-8 Validation(Medium)
item.description: LeetCode 393 - UTF-8 Validation Given an integer array data representing the data, return whether it is a valid UTF-8 encoding (i.e. it translates to a sequence of valid UTF-8 encoded characters). A character in UTF8 can be from 1 to 4 bytes long, subjected to the following rules: For a 1-byte character, the first bit is a 0, followed by its Unicode code. For an n-bytes character, the first

item.title: [Leetcode DP] Counting Bits(Easy)
item.description: LeetCode 338 - Counting Bits Given an integer n, return an array ans of length n + 1 such that for each i (0 <= i <= n), ans[i] is the number of 1’s in the binary representation of i. example: Input: n = 2 Output: [0,1,1] Explanation: 0 --> 0 1 --> 1 2 --> 10 Input: n = 5 Output: [0,1,1,2,1,2] Explanation: 0 --> 0 1 --> 1
